texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I was working with a CentOS 5 x86_64 installation running VMWare server last week when I stumbled upon this error:
texts.text: I was working with a CentOS 5 x86_64 installation running VMWare server last week when I stumbled upon this error:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
Use of uninitialized value in string eq at
/usr/lib64/perl5/site_perl/5.8.8/x86_64-linux-thread-multi/VMware/VmPerl.pm line 114.
texts.text:
Use of uninitialized value in string eq at
/usr/lib64/perl5/site_perl/5.8.8/x86_64-linux-thread-multi/VMware/VmPerl.pm line 114.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You can run the vmware-cmd application with this error (it's not a fatal error) and keep going with your normal business. However, if you want to remove the error, comment out lines 114 and 115 in the Perl module referenced by the error:
texts.text: You can run the vmware-cmd application with this error (it's not a fatal error) and keep going with your normal business. However, if you want to remove the error, comment out lines 114 and 115 in the Perl module referenced by the error:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
die "Perl API Version does not match dynamic library version."
    unless (version() eq $VERSION);
texts.text:
die "Perl API Version does not match dynamic library version."
    unless (version() eq $VERSION);

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Commenting out these lines does not affect the VMWare server in any way.
texts.text: Commenting out these lines does not affect the VMWare server in any way.
